DataElement.preferredName: Creatinine Alanine Aminotransferase Bilirubin Laboratory Test Result Greater Than or Equal To Moderate Adverse Event Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether creatinine, alanine aminotransferase, or bilirubin laboratory test results were greater than or equal to a moderate adverse event was present.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Creatinine Alanine Aminotransferase Bilirubin Laboratory Test Result Greater Than or Equal To Moderate Adverse Event Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._An experience that is alleviated with simple therapeutic treatments. The event impacts usual daily activities. Includes laboratory test alterations indicating injury, but without long-term risk._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time._The outcome of a laboratory test._The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function._A family of pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in cellular nitrogen metabolism, amino acid metabolism, and liver gluconeogenesis. Alanine aminotransferase specifically and reversibly catalyzes the transfer of an amino group from L-alanine to alpha-ketoglutarate forming pyruvate and L-glutamate._A dark orange, yellow pigment that is the product of the breakdown of iron in the blood; it is conjugated in the liver and excreted in the bile.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Creatinine Alanine Aminotransferase Bilirubin Laboratory Test Result
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.:A family of pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in cellular nitrogen metabolism, amino acid metabolism, and liver gluconeogenesis. Alanine aminotransferase specifically and reversibly catalyzes the transfer of an amino group from L-alanine to alpha-ketoglutarate forming pyruvate and L-glutamate.:A bile pigment that is a degradation product of HEME.:The outcome of a laboratory test.

Concepts.definition: The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.

A family of pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in cellular nitrogen metabolism, amino acid metabolism, and liver gluconeogenesis. Alanine aminotransferase specifically and reversibly catalyzes the transfer of an amino group from L-alanine to alpha-ketoglutarate forming pyruvate and L-glutamate.
A dark orange, yellow pigment that is the product of the breakdown of iron in the blood; it is conjugated in the liver and excreted in the bile.
The outcome of a laboratory test.

Property.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Moderate Adverse Event Present
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:An experience that is alleviated with simple therapeutic treatments. The event impacts usual daily activities. Includes laboratory test alterations indicating injury, but without long-term risk.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
An experience that is alleviated with simple therapeutic treatments. The event impacts usual daily activities. Includes laboratory test alterations indicating injury, but without long-term risk.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was creatinine, alanine aminotransferase, or bilirubin laboratory test results greater than or equal to a moderate adverse event present?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG-TEXT-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have creatinine greater than or equal to 1.5 x upper limit of normal for sex and current age or Grade 2 or higher ALT or bilirubin during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient have moderate adverse event or high in creatinine, ALT or bilirubin laboratory tests during this reporting period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have any grade alanine aminotransferase (ALT) elevation during this Maintenance cycle?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have any grade bilirubin elevation during this Maintenance cycle?

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.11.17 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0003092. ak 2022.10.5 Reviewed, cleaned up and released. ak
